thread.title: Little hit, big win; Royals beat Jays for 2-0 lead in ALCS
thread.title_full: Little hit, big win; Royals beat Jays for 2-0 lead in ALCS - KCTV5

author: cbs8
title: Little hit, big win; Royals beat Jays for 2-0 lead in ALCS
text:
By DAVE SKRETTA
AP Sports Writer KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) - Ben Zobrist's easy fly that somehow fell in for a hit began a five-run rally against David Price, and the Kansas City Royals rolled to a 6-3 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays on Saturday for a 2-0 lead in the AL Championship Series.
Wade Davis survived a shaky ninth for Kansas City after Luke Hochevar and Danny Duffy were solid in relief of Yordano Ventura. Kelvin Herrera breezed through the eighth.
Davis gave up a leadoff single and walked pinch-hitter Cliff Pennington, but bounced back to strike out leadoff man Ben Revere and MVP candidate Josh Donaldson. Jose Bautista then flied out to right to give Davis his third postseason save and the Royals another postseason comeback win.
